Description: The terracotta face of a cat broken from a hollow figure. An incuse lotus flower is on the forehead. The whole figure was formed in a three-piece mould; some incuse details (flower, hair in ears, whiskers) may have been incised after leaving the mould. Micaceous orange-brown Nile silt, with smooth red-brown surface. Traces of a white dressing.
Curator's comments: Terracotta IV Donated: Arthur Bagnold. Roman, first to second century AD. Comparanda: Close, but probably not the same mould-series: 1879,1120.39 above, q.v. for comparable material.
Bibliographic references: Terracotta / Catalogue of Terracottas in the British Museum (3713)
Acquisition name: Donated by: Col Arthur Henry Bagnold
